In your Rebar directory run the following command to clone the ascended-camera plugin.
This script is a dependencie for Ascended-Tuning.
To start using our camera script, ensure you have a Lifecycle Hook (Webview) set up. Additionally, you'll need a camera.ts file on the client side to utilize the plugin correctly.

Use the following command to install Simple-Item-Manager by Stuyk
Install vuedraggable@next per pnpm
Items can be created inside of src/items/file.ts - you can also add new files.
If you add new .ts files make sure to update the allItems Array in the index.ts properly.

In your Rebar directory run the following command to clone the ascended-factions plugin.

The ASC-Factions module provides a set of functions for managing factions within the alt-server environment. This includes creating, updating, and deleting factions, as well as managing faction members and ranks.
Creates a new faction with the specified name.
Checks if a faction with the given name already exists.
If not, creates a new faction document and adds it to the database.
Logs the creation status.
Adds a new rank to the specified faction.
Checks if the faction exists.
Adds the new rank if it doesn't already exist.
Logs the addition status.
Removes a rank from the specified faction.
Checks if the faction exists.
Removes the rank if it exists.
Logs the removal status.
Deletes the specified faction.
Checks if the faction exists.
Deletes the faction document from the database.
Logs the deletion status.
Renames the specified faction.
Checks if the faction exists.
Renames the faction.
Logs the renaming status.
Clears all members from the specified faction.
Checks if the faction exists.
Clears all members from the faction.
Logs the clearing status.
Returns all factions.
Retrieves all factions from the database.
Uses a cached version if available.
Returns the faction with the specified name.
Retrieves the faction from the cached list of factions.
Returns the faction a player belongs to.
Checks all factions to find which one the player is a member of.
Logs if the player is not found in any faction.
Returns the rank of a player within their faction.
Checks all factions to find the player's rank.
Logs if the player is not found in any faction.
Clears the cached factions list.
Resets the cached factions list and the initialization flag.
Ensure the factions collection is created:
The module uses alt.logWarning to log various statuses and errors throughout the operations.

This module provides comprehensive functionality for managing factions in alt-server, including creation, updating, and deletion of factions, as well as member and rank management. It leverages a caching mechanism to optimize performance and ensure efficient data retrieval.

The ASC-Factions module provides a set of functions for managing factions within the alt-server environment. This includes creating, updating, and deleting factions, as well as managing faction members and ranks.

l: inviteMember(factionName: string, memberId: number, rankName: string, isLeader = false)
p: Invites a member to a faction with the specified rank.
Checks if the faction exists.
Checks if the rank exists in the faction.
Adds the member to the faction if not already a member.
Logs the invitation status.
Kicks a member from their faction.
Finds the member in the factions.
Removes the member from the faction.
Logs the removal status.
Promotes a member to the next rank in their faction.
Checks if the faction exists.
Promotes the member to the next rank.
Logs the promotion status.
Demotes a member to the previous rank in their faction.
Checks if the faction exists.
Demotes the member to the previous rank.
Logs the demotion status.
Ensure the factions collection is created:
The module uses alt.logWarning to log various statuses and errors throughout the operations.

This module provides comprehensive functionality for managing factions in alt-server, including creation, updating, and deletion of factions, as well as member and rank management. It leverages a caching mechanism to optimize performance and ensure efficient data retrieval.

The ASC-Factions module provides a set of functions for managing factions within the alt-server environment. This includes creating, updating, and deleting factions, as well as managing faction members and ranks.

l: addRankPermission(factionName: string, rankName: string, permission: string)
p: Adds a permission to a rank within a faction.
Checks if the faction exists.
Checks if the rank exists within the faction.
Adds the permission to the rank if not already present.
Updates the database with the new permission.
Logs the addition status.
Updates member permissions.

l: removeRankPermission(factionName: string, rankName: string, permission: string)
p: Removes a permission from a rank within a faction.
Checks if the faction exists.
Checks if the rank exists within the faction.
Removes the permission from the rank if present.
Updates the database with the removed permission.
Logs the removal status.
Updates member permissions.

l: checkRankPermission(factionName: string, rankName: string, permission: string): Promiseboolean
p: Checks if a rank within a faction has a specific permission.
Checks if the faction exists.
Checks if the rank exists within the faction.
Checks if the rank has the specified permission.
Logs the permission status.
Returns true if the permission exists, false otherwise.

l: updateMemberPermissions(factionName: string, memberId: number, newRankName: string)
p: Updates a member's permissions when their rank changes.
Checks if the faction exists.
Finds the member in the faction.
Updates the member's rank and permissions.
Updates the database with the new rank and permissions.
Logs the update status.
Revokes all group permissions for a member.
Logs the member information.
Removes all group permissions for the member.
Ensure the factions collection is created:
The module uses alt.logWarning to log various statuses and errors throughout the operations.

This module provides comprehensive functionality for managing faction ranks and permissions in alt-server, including adding, removing, checking, and updating permissions, as well as revoking all permissions for a specific member. It leverages a caching mechanism to optimize performance and ensure efficient data retrieval.
The TypeScriptSQL class provides a convenient wrapper around MySQL operations using promises. It allows for basic CRUD operations, table creation, and connection handling.
Description: Initializes a new instance of the TypeScriptSQL class and establishes a database connection.
Parameters:
config(mysql.ConnectionConfig): The configuration object for the database connection.
Description: Executes a SQL query.
Parameters:
sql(string): The SQL query string.
args(any[], optional): An array of arguments for parameterized queries.
Returns: A promise that resolves with the query results.
Description: Creates a table if it does not exist.
Parameters:
table(string): The name of the table.
tableDefinition(string): The SQL table definition.
Returns: A promise that resolves when the table is created.
Description: Inserts a new record into a table.
Parameters:
table(string): The name of the table.
data(object): An object representing the record to insert.
Returns: A promise that resolves when the record is inserted.
Description: Reads records from a table.
Parameters:
table(string): The name of the table.
conditions(object, optional): An object representing query conditions.
Returns: A promise that resolves with the query results.
Description: Inserts a new record or updates an existing record.
Parameters:
table(string): The name of the table.
data(object): An object representing the record to insert or update.
Returns: A promise that resolves when the operation is complete.
Description: Updates existing records in a table.
Parameters:
table(string): The name of the table.
data(object): An object representing the new data.
conditions(object): An object representing the query conditions.
Returns: A promise that resolves when the records are updated.
Description: Deletes records from a table.
Parameters:
table(string): The name of the table.
conditions(object): An object representing the query conditions.
Returns: A promise that resolves when the records are deleted.
Description: Closes the database connection.
Returns: A promise that resolves when the connection is closed.
